title: On This Day - What Happened Today In History | Britannica
text: TODAY IN HISTORY February 4Featured Event 1938 Walt Disney's Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is shown in theaters across the U.S. On this day in 1937, the animated feature film Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs came out in theaters nationwide. In a series of maneuvers that critics described as “Disney's folly,” producer Walt Disney mortgaged his house and sold his car in order to pay production costs. The movie, which cost $1.5 million ($36 million with inflation), was wildly successful and eventually became one of the highest-grossing of all time, showing that audiences were happy to watch full-length animated features.
